ErrorBoundary.title: Something went wrong.
ErrorBoundary.message: Please reload the page or try again after some time.

HeroJourney.description: Empowering rural and underserved communities with accessible healthcare through AI-driven risk assessment, health education, and instant clinic connectivity.

Features.sectionDescription: Everything you need for better health management in one place

items.title: Symptom Checker
items.description: Assess your health with our AI-powered symptom analysis

items.title: Disease Library
items.description: Learn about diseases, symptoms, and prevention

items.title: Prevention Tips
items.description: Get personalized health and wellness guidance

WhyChoose.title: Why Choose HealthBuddy?
WhyChoose.description: We're on a mission to make quality healthcare accessible to everyone, especially in rural and underserved regions.

CTASection.title: Take Control of Your Health Today
CTASection.subtitle: Start your health assessment in just 2 minutes

SymptomAnalyzer.title: Symptom Analyzer
SymptomAnalyzer.subtitle: Describe how you're feeling and we'll suggest which conditions to check

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.description: Describe your symptoms in your own words. Our system analyzes them and suggests relevant health checks.

SymptomAnalyzer.placeholder: Example: headache and fever since last 2 days

invalid.title: Input unclear
invalid.message: We couldn’t understand your symptoms clearly.

SymptomAnalyzer.disclaimer: This is not a diagnosis. Please consult a healthcare professional.

SymptomChecker.title: Symptom Checker
SymptomChecker.subtitle: Select a condition to start your health assessment

notice.title: Important Notice
notice.description: This tool provides general guidance only and is not a substitute for professional medical advice. Always consult a healthcare provider for accurate diagnosis and treatment.

heart-attack.name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
heart-attack.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is suddenly blocked, leading to tissue damage.
symptoms: Pain in arms, neck, jaw, or back
heart-attack.causes: Blockage of coronary arteries due to plaque buildup or blood clots.
heart-attack.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate emergency medical attention if chest pain or severe discomfort occurs.

cardiac-arrest.name: Cardiac Arrest
cardiac-arrest.description: Cardiac arrest occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating, cutting off blood flow to the brain and other vital organs.
cardiac-arrest.causes: Electrical malfunction of the heart causing abnormal rhythm.
cardiac-arrest.when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if a person collapses and is unresponsive.

heart-failure.name: Heart Failure
heart-failure.description: A chronic condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet the body’s needs.
heart-failure.causes: Coronary artery disease, hypertension, or damaged heart muscle.

hypertension.name: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure)
hypertension.description: A condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high over time.
hypertension.causes: Genetics, lifestyle factors, excess salt intake.

coronary-artery-disease.name: Coronary Artery Disease
coronary-artery-disease.description: A condition caused by narrowing of coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart.

lung-cancer.name: Lung Cancer
lung-cancer.description: A cancer that begins in the lungs, most commonly associated with smoking.
lung-cancer.causes: Long-term exposure to tobacco smoke or environmental pollutants.
lung-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 3 weeks or coughing blood.

asthma.name: Asthma
asthma.description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing.
asthma.causes: Allergens, exercise, infections, or genetic factors.

bronchitis.name: Bronchitis
bronchitis.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to coughing and mucus production.

pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.

sinusitis.name: Sinusitis
sinusitis.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain and nasal congestion.

copd.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
copd.description: A group of progressive lung diseases that block airflow.
copd.causes: Long-term smoking or exposure to irritants.

allergic-rhinitis.name: Allergic Rhinitis
allergic-rhinitis.description: An allergic reaction causing sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes.
allergic-rhinitis.causes: Exposure to allergens such as pollen or dust.

acid-reflux-gerd.name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
acid-reflux-gerd.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
acid-reflux-gerd.causes: Weak lower esophageal sphincter allowing acid reflux.
prevention_tips: Do not lie down after eating
acid-reflux-gerd.when_to_seek_help: Frequent or severe heartburn not relieved by medication.

gastritis.name: Gastritis
gastritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause pain and nausea.
gastritis.causes: Infection, excessive alcohol use, or prolonged NSAID use.
gastritis.when_to_seek_help: Persistent stomach pain or vomiting blood.

peptic-ulcer.name: Peptic Ulcer
peptic-ulcer.description: Open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or upper small intestine.
peptic-ulcer.causes: Helicobacter pylori infection or long-term NSAID use.
peptic-ulcer.when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain or black stools.

irritable-bowel-syndrome.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
irritable-bowel-syndrome.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping and bowel changes.

jaundice.name: Jaundice
jaundice.description: A condition characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
jaundice.causes: Liver disease, hepatitis, or bile duct obstruction.
jaundice.when_to_seek_help: Sudden yellowing of skin or eyes.

food-poisoning.name: Food Poisoning
food-poisoning.description: Illness caused by eating contaminated food.
food-poisoning.causes: Bacteria, viruses, or parasites in food.

constipation.name: Constipation
constipation.description: A condition where bowel movements become infrequent or difficult.
constipation.causes: Low fiber intake, dehydration, or inactivity.
constipation.when_to_seek_help: Persistent constipation lasting more than 2 weeks.

stroke.name: Stroke
stroke.description: A medical emergency that occurs when blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
symptoms: Sudden weakness on one side of the body
stroke.causes: Blocked or ruptured blood vessels in the brain.
stroke.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency medical attention is required.

migraine.name: Migraine
migraine.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, recurring headaches.
migraine.causes: Neurological triggers, hormonal changes, and stress.
migraine.when_to_seek_help: Severe or frequent headaches disrupting daily life.

epilepsy.name: Epilepsy
epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.
epilepsy.causes: Brain injury, genetic factors, or infections.

parkinsons-disease.name: Parkinson’s Disease
parkinsons-disease.description: A progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement.

alzheimers-disease.name: Alzheimer’s Disease
alzheimers-disease.description: A progressive disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.

vertigo.name: Vertigo
vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness.
vertigo.causes: Inner ear problems or nerve issues.

dengue.name: Dengue
dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever and severe body pain.
dengue.causes: Dengue virus transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes.
dengue.when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain, bleeding, or persistent vomiting.

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.description: A life-threatening disease transmitted through mosquito bites.
malaria.when_to_seek_help: Recurring fever with chills or confusion.

tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs but can affect other organs.
tuberculosis.when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 2 weeks or coughing blood.

typhoid-fever.name: Typhoid Fever
typhoid-fever.description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.
typhoid-fever.when_to_seek_help: Persistent high fever or severe weakness.

cholera.name: Cholera
cholera.description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by contaminated water.

hepatitis-b.name: Hepatitis B
hepatitis-b.description: A viral infection that attacks the liver.

hiv-aids.name: HIV/AIDS
hiv-aids.description: A chronic condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus that weakens the immune system.
hiv-aids.when_to_seek_help: Recurrent infections or unexplained weight loss.

chickenpox.name: Chickenpox
chickenpox.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.

back-pain.name: Back Pain
back-pain.description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back.
back-pain.causes: Muscle strain, poor posture, or injury.
back-pain.when_to_seek_help: Severe or persistent pain lasting more than a few weeks.

sciatica.name: Sciatica
sciatica.description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve from the lower back to the leg.
sciatica.when_to_seek_help: Severe pain or weakness in the leg.

arthritis.name: Arthritis
arthritis.description: Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness.
arthritis.causes: Joint wear and tear or autoimmune conditions.

osteoporosis.name: Osteoporosis
osteoporosis.description: A condition characterized by weakened bones and increased fracture risk.
osteoporosis.causes: Low bone density due to aging or hormonal changes.

gout.name: Gout
gout.description: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe joint pain.

fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
fibromyalgia.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
fibromyalgia.causes: Abnormal pain processing in the brain.

type-2-diabetes.name: Type 2 Diabetes
type-2-diabetes.description: A chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.
type-2-diabetes.causes: Insulin resistance leading to high blood sugar levels.
type-2-diabetes.when_to_seek_help: Persistently high blood sugar levels or symptoms of diabetes.

obesity.name: Obesity
obesity.description: A condition involving excessive body fat that increases health risks.
obesity.causes: Excess calorie intake and lack of physical activity.

thyroid-disorders.name: Thyroid Disorders
thyroid-disorders.causes: Hormonal imbalance due to thyroid dysfunction.
thyroid-disorders.when_to_seek_help: Unexplained weight changes or persistent fatigue.

depression.name: Depression
depression.description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
depression.causes: Chemical imbalance, prolonged stress, or traumatic experiences.
depression.when_to_seek_help: Thoughts of self-harm or inability to function in daily life.

anxiety-disorder.name: Anxiety Disorder
anxiety-disorder.description: A condition involving excessive fear, worry, or nervousness.
anxiety-disorder.when_to_seek_help: Anxiety that interferes with daily activities.

insomnia.name: Insomnia
insomnia.description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
insomnia.causes: Stress, anxiety, or poor sleep habits.
insomnia.when_to_seek_help: Persistent sleep problems affecting daily life.

acne.name: Acne
acne.description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.
acne.causes: Hormonal changes and excess oil production.

eczema.name: Eczema
eczema.description: A condition causing inflamed, itchy, and irritated skin.
eczema.causes: Immune system dysfunction and allergic reactions.
eczema.when_to_seek_help: Severe itching or signs of skin infection.

psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
psoriasis.description: An autoimmune condition causing rapid buildup of skin cells.

skin-cancer-melanoma.name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
skin-cancer-melanoma.description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops from pigment-producing cells.
skin-cancer-melanoma.when_to_seek_help: Changes in size, shape, or color of a mole.

glaucoma.name: Glaucoma
glaucoma.description: An eye condition that damages the optic nerve, often due to increased eye pressure.
glaucoma.causes: Increased intraocular pressure damaging the optic nerve.
glaucoma.when_to_seek_help: Sudden vision changes or severe eye pain.

cataracts.name: Cataracts
cataracts.description: Clouding of the eye lens that leads to blurred or reduced vision.
cataracts.causes: Aging and prolonged exposure to ultraviolet light.

conjunctivitis.name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye)
conjunctivitis.description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva causing redness and irritation in the eye.
conjunctivitis.causes: Viral or bacterial infection, or allergic reaction.
conjunctivitis.when_to_seek_help: Severe pain, vision changes, or symptoms worsening.

breast-cancer.name: Breast Cancer
breast-cancer.description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.
breast-cancer.when_to_seek_help: New breast lump or noticeable changes.

colorectal-cancer.name: Colorectal Cancer
colorectal-cancer.description: Cancer affecting the colon or rectum.
colorectal-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Persistent bowel changes or rectal bleeding.

prostate-cancer.name: Prostate Cancer
prostate-cancer.description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland.

liver-cancer.name: Liver Cancer
liver-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the liver cells.
liver-cancer.causes: Chronic liver disease or hepatitis infection.
liver-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Persistent abdominal pain or yellowing of skin.

pancreatic-cancer.name: Pancreatic Cancer
pancreatic-cancer.description: Cancer that forms in the pancreas.
pancreatic-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Unexplained weight loss and persistent pain.

leukemia.name: Leukemia
leukemia.description: Cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

brain-cancer.name: Brain Cancer
brain-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in brain tissue.

ovarian-cancer.name: Ovarian Cancer
ovarian-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries.

cervical-cancer.name: Cervical Cancer
cervical-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the cervix.

thyroid-cancer.name: Thyroid Cancer
thyroid-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the thyroid gland.

kidney-cancer.name: Kidney Cancer
kidney-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the kidneys.

bladder-cancer.name: Bladder Cancer
bladder-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the bladder lining.
bladder-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Blood in urine or urinary pain.

oral-cancer.name: Oral Cancer
oral-cancer.description: Cancer affecting the mouth or throat.

anemia.name: Anemia
anemia.description: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells.

urinary-tract-infection.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
urinary-tract-infection.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.

questions.question: Are you experiencing chest pain or discomfort?
Is the pain spreading to your arm, neck, or jaw?
Do you feel shortness of breath?
Do you feel nauseous or have cold sweats?
Do you have a history of heart disease or high blood pressure?

low: Exercise as advised by your doctor
moderate: Seek medical advice if symptoms worsen
high: Ensure someone stays with you until help arrives

questions.question: Have you experienced sudden collapse or loss of consciousness?
Did the episode involve no breathing or gasping?
Do you have a known history of heart rhythm problems?
Have you had a previous heart attack?
Did this event occur during physical exertion?

moderate: Monitor for warning symptoms such as dizziness or palpitations
Follow medical advice and prescribed tests
Seek immediate care if symptoms recur or worsen
high: Begin CPR if trained and safe to do so
Do not leave the person unattended
Follow emergency operator instructions until help arrives

questions.question: Do you experience shortness of breath during routine activities?
Do you feel breathless when lying flat?
Have you noticed swelling in your legs or ankles?
Do you feel unusually fatigued most days?
Do you have a history of heart disease or hypertension?

low: Exercise as advised by your healthcare provider
moderate: Monitor swelling, breathing, and fatigue closely
Seek medical advice if symptoms worsen
high: Ensure someone is available to assist you if needed

questions.question: Have you been told you have high blood pressure before?
Do you experience frequent headaches or dizziness?
Do you consume a high-salt or processed-food diet?
Do you have a family history of high blood pressure?
Do you exercise less than 3 times a week?

moderate: Reduce salt and processed food intake
Consult a healthcare provider for guidance
high: Begin or adjust medications as prescribed
Avoid unmanaged stress and physical strain
Seek urgent care if severe symptoms occur

questions.question: Do you experience chest discomfort during physical activity?
Does the discomfort improve with rest?
Do you have high cholesterol?
Do you smoke or have you smoked previously?
Do you have diabetes?

low: Follow a balanced, low-fat and low-cholesterol diet
Engage in regular, doctor-approved physical activity
Monitor blood pressure and cholesterol levels
moderate: Monitor chest discomfort and related symptoms
Follow prescribed medications and lifestyle advice
Seek medical attention if symptoms increase or occur at rest
high: Visit the nearest medical facility promptly
Ensure someone is available to assist you if symptoms worsen

questions.question: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 3 weeks?
Have you coughed up blood?
Have you experienced unexplained weight loss?
Do you currently smoke or have a long smoking history?
Do you have persistent chest pain?

low: Avoid smoking and exposure to secondhand smoke
Maintain a healthy lifestyle and balanced diet
Avoid exposure to environmental pollutants when possible
Schedule routine health checkups if at risk
moderate: Discuss symptoms and risk factors with a healthcare provider
Undergo recommended imaging or diagnostic tests
Seek medical advice if symptoms persist or worsen
high: Follow medical guidance for further testing
Do not delay evaluation of serious symptoms
Ensure emotional and family support during evaluation

questions.question: Do you experience wheezing or whistling sounds while breathing?
Do you feel shortness of breath during exercise or at night?
Do your symptoms worsen with allergens, dust, or cold air?
Do you have a personal or family history of asthma or allergies?
Have you needed an inhaler or urgent care for breathing issues?

low: Follow a regular exercise routine as tolerated
Keep prescribed inhalers accessible if advised
moderate: Review and adjust asthma action plan if needed
Seek medical advice if symptoms become more frequent
high: Use rescue inhaler immediately if prescribed
Do not delay treatment for severe breathing difficulty

questions.question: Have you had a cough lasting more than 2 weeks?
Are you coughing up mucus or phlegm?
Do you experience chest tightness or discomfort?
Have you had a recent cold or respiratory infection?
Do you smoke or are you exposed to air pollution?

low: Rest adequately and stay well hydrated
Use humidified air to ease coughing
moderate: Follow medical advice for symptom relief
Monitor for fever or worsening cough
Seek care if symptoms persist beyond expected duration
high: Visit a healthcare facility if breathing worsens
Seek urgent care if high fever or shortness of breath develops

questions.question: Do you have a high fever with chills?
Are you experiencing chest pain while breathing or coughing?
Do you have shortness of breath at rest?
Are you coughing up yellow, green, or bloody mucus?
Are you over 65 or immunocompromised?

low: Seek medical advice if symptoms worsen
high: Visit the nearest emergency department immediately
Ensure assistance is available if condition deteriorates

questions.question: Do you have facial pain or pressure around the nose or eyes?
Do you have nasal congestion or blocked nose lasting over 10 days?
Do you have thick yellow or green nasal discharge?
Do your symptoms worsen when bending forward?
Have you recently had a cold or allergies?

low: Practice home care and maintain hydration
Use steam inhalation or saline rinses
moderate: Monitor for fever or worsening facial pain
Seek care if symptoms persist beyond 10 days
high: Monitor for complications such as swelling or severe pain
Ensure follow-up with a healthcare provider

questions.question: Do you have chronic cough lasting several months each year?
Do you experience breathlessness during daily activities?
Have you smoked for more than 10 years?
Do you frequently produce mucus or phlegm?
Have you had frequent respiratory infections?

low: Maintain regular physical activity as tolerated
Stay up to date with vaccinations
moderate: Follow prescribed inhaler or medication regimen
Monitor for worsening breathlessness or infections
Seek medical advice if daily activities become difficult
high: Visit the nearest medical facility promptly
Do not delay care during severe breathing difficulty

questions.question: Do you have frequent sneezing, runny or itchy nose?
Do your symptoms worsen during certain seasons?
Do you have itchy or watery eyes?
Do you have a personal or family history of allergies?
Do antihistamines improve your symptoms?

low: Practice regular nasal hygiene if advised
Use protective measures during high-allergen seasons
moderate: Seek medical advice if symptoms persist
high: Ensure proper follow-up and symptom control

questions.question: Do you experience burning sensation in the chest after meals?
Do symptoms worsen when lying down?
Do you experience sour taste or regurgitation?
Do you frequently eat large or spicy meals?
Have symptoms persisted for more than 3 months?

low: Avoid spicy, fatty, and late-night meals
Avoid lying down immediately after eating
moderate: Seek care if symptoms persist or worsen
high: Seek urgent care if chest pain is severe or unusual

questions.question: Do you experience upper abdominal pain or burning?
Do you feel nauseous or vomit after eating?
Do you regularly consume alcohol?
Do you frequently use painkillers (NSAIDs)?
Have symptoms lasted more than 2 weeks?

low: Modify diet and avoid irritating foods
high: Seek urgent care if vomiting or bleeding occurs

questions.question: Do you experience burning stomach pain that improves or worsens with meals?
Have you noticed black stools or vomiting blood?
Do you use painkillers frequently?
Do you smoke or consume alcohol regularly?
Have symptoms persisted for several weeks?

low: Eat balanced meals at regular intervals
Seek medical advice if pain persists
high: Do not delay treatment for bleeding symptoms
Avoid food or medications unless advised

questions.question: Do you experience recurrent abdominal pain?
Are your symptoms associated with changes in bowel habits?
Do symptoms improve after a bowel movement?
Have symptoms been present for more than 3 months?
Do stress or certain foods worsen symptoms?

moderate: Review dietary plans such as fiber intake
Seek care if symptoms interfere with daily life

questions.question: Do you have fewer than three bowel movements per week?
Do you pass hard or difficult-to-pass stools?
Do you feel incomplete bowel emptying?
Do you consume a low-fiber diet or inadequate fluids?
Have symptoms persisted for more than two weeks?

moderate: Consult a provider if symptoms persist
high: Seek care if pain or bleeding occurs

questions.question: Have you experienced sudden weakness or numbness on one side of the body?
Do you have sudden difficulty speaking or understanding speech?
Have you experienced sudden vision loss or blurred vision?
Did symptoms begin suddenly?
Do you have high blood pressure or diabetes?

low: Control blood pressure and blood sugar
high: Avoid food or drink unless advised
Follow emergency instructions until help arrives

questions.question: Do you experience recurring throbbing headaches?
Are headaches associated with nausea or vomiting?
Do you experience sensitivity to light or sound during headaches?
Do headaches worsen with physical activity?
Do headaches last longer than 4 hours?

moderate: Seek care if headaches become frequent
high: Seek urgent care for severe or unusual headaches

questions.question: Have you experienced repeated seizure episodes?
Do you experience loss of consciousness during episodes?
Have others observed shaking or jerking movements?
Do you experience confusion after episodes?
Do you have a history of head injury or brain infection?

high: Follow emergency instructions if seizures persist

questions.question: Do you experience resting tremors in hands or fingers?
Do you feel muscle stiffness or rigidity?
Have your movements become slower over time?
Do you experience balance or walking difficulties?
Have symptoms gradually worsened over months or years?

low: Engage in balance and mobility exercises
moderate: Engage in physical and occupational therapy
high: Follow advanced care plans if advised

questions.question: Have you noticed progressive memory loss?
Do you have difficulty performing familiar tasks?
Do you experience confusion about time or place?
Have family members noticed behavioral changes?
Are symptoms progressively worsening?

low: Encourage mental stimulation and social interaction
high: Consult a neurologist or memory clinic

questions.question: Do you experience spinning sensation or dizziness?
Are symptoms triggered by head movement?
Do you experience nausea or vomiting?
Do you have hearing changes or ringing in ears?
Have symptoms persisted more than a week?

high: Consult an ENT or neurologist if advised

questions.question: Do you have a sudden high fever?
Do you experience severe joint or muscle pain?
Have you noticed skin rash or bleeding gums?
Have you recently been bitten by mosquitoes?
Do you have nausea or vomiting?

moderate: Seek care if bleeding symptoms appear

questions.question: Do you have recurring fever with chills and sweating?
Have you traveled to or live in a malaria-prone area?
Do you experience headache or body aches?
Have symptoms lasted more than 2 days?
Do you have nausea or vomiting?
Do you have a cough lasting more than 2 weeks?
Do you experience weight loss or loss of appetite?
Do you have night sweats or fever?
Have you coughed up blood?
Have you been in close contact with a TB patient?

low: Avoid close contact if coughing persists

questions.question: Do you have persistent high fever?
Do you experience abdominal pain or diarrhea?
Have you consumed contaminated food or water recently?
Do you feel extreme weakness or fatigue?
Have symptoms lasted more than 3 days?
Do you have sudden severe watery diarrhea?
Are you experiencing signs of dehydration?
Have you consumed unsafe water recently?
Do you have vomiting?

low: Seek care if dehydration signs appear

questions.question: Do you feel persistent fatigue or weakness?
Have you noticed yellowing of skin or eyes?
Do you have abdominal pain or nausea?
Have you had unprotected sex or needle exposure?
Have symptoms lasted more than 2 weeks?

moderate: Undergo liver function tests if advised
high: Consult a hepatologist or infectious disease specialist

questions.question: Do you have recurrent infections or prolonged fever?
Have you experienced unexplained weight loss?
Have you engaged in unprotected sex or shared needles?
Do you experience persistent diarrhea?
Have symptoms persisted for months?
Do you have an itchy blister-like rash?
Do you have fever with fatigue?
Have you been in contact with someone with chickenpox?
Are you unvaccinated?

high: Monitor for breathing or neurological symptoms

questions.question: Do you experience persistent back pain?
Does the pain limit your daily activities?
Did the pain start after injury or heavy lifting?
Do you feel stiffness in the morning?
Has the pain lasted more than 4 weeks?

low: Apply heat or cold as needed
moderate: Use pain relief measures as advised

questions.question: Does pain radiate from the lower back down the leg?
Do you experience tingling or numbness in the leg?
Does pain worsen when sitting or bending?
Do you have weakness in the affected leg?
Has the pain lasted more than 2 weeks?
Do you experience joint pain or stiffness?
Is stiffness worse in the morning?
Do joints appear swollen or warm?
Has pain lasted for several months?
Do you have reduced joint mobility?

low: Practice joint care and regular low-impact exercise
Use heat or cold therapy for stiffness
moderate: Follow recommended exercise or physical therapy plans
Avoid activities that worsen joint pain
Seek care if swelling or stiffness increases
high: Consult a rheumatologist or orthopedic specialist

questions.question: Have you had fractures from minor injuries?
Have you noticed loss of height or posture changes?
Are you postmenopausal or above age 60?
Do you have low calcium or vitamin D intake?
Do you have a family history of osteoporosis?

low: Maintain bone health through diet and exercise
Ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake
moderate: Undergo bone density testing if advised
high: Consult an endocrinologist or orthopedic specialist

questions.question: Have you had sudden severe joint pain, especially in the big toe?
Is the joint swollen, red, and warm?
Did the pain start suddenly at night?
Do you consume alcohol or high-purine foods frequently?
Have you had similar attacks before?

moderate: Rest the affected joint during flare-ups
Seek care if attacks become frequent
high: Visit a healthcare facility for severe pain

questions.question: Do you have widespread body pain for more than 3 months?
Do you feel persistent fatigue despite rest?
Do you have sleep disturbances?
Do symptoms worsen with stress or exertion?
Have symptoms persisted for several months?

low: Focus on lifestyle and stress management
moderate: Engage in physical or behavioral therapy if advised
Seek care if symptoms affect daily life
high: Consult a rheumatologist or pain specialist
Ensure mental health support if needed

questions.question: Do you experience frequent urination and excessive thirst?
Have you experienced unexplained fatigue?
Do you have a family history of diabetes?
Have you noticed slow wound healing or frequent infections?
Are you overweight or physically inactive?

moderate: Undergo blood sugar testing if advised

questions.question: Have you experienced significant weight gain recently?
Do you feel breathless with minimal physical activity?
Is physical activity limited in your daily routine?
Do you consume high-calorie or processed foods frequently?
Do you have obesity-related conditions like diabetes or hypertension?

moderate: Develop a structured diet and activity plan
Seek guidance if weight continues to increase

questions.question: Have you noticed unexplained weight changes?
Do you experience persistent fatigue or weakness?
Are you unusually sensitive to heat or cold?
Have you noticed hair loss or skin changes?
Is there a family history of thyroid disease?

AssessmentResult.generalAdvice: Follow general preventive health measures and consult a healthcare professional if symptoms persist.

emergency.title: Emergency Symptom Detected
emergency.message: One or more of your answers indicate a potentially life-threatening condition. Please seek immediate medical attention or contact emergency services.

nextSteps.emergency: This is a medical emergency. Please seek immediate care or call emergency services.
nextSteps.high: Immediate medical consultation is strongly advised.
nextSteps.low: Continue monitoring your health and maintain healthy habits.

AssessmentResult.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This assessment is informational only and does not constitute medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment.

Diseases.title: Disease Information Hub
Diseases.subtitle: Learn about common diseases, their symptoms, causes, and prevention

Prevention.title: Prevention & Wellness
Prevention.subtitle: Simple steps for a healthier life and disease prevention

nutrition.title: Nutrition
tips: Eat a balanced diet rich in fruits and vegetables
Limit processed foods and added sugars
Stay hydrated — drink 8–10 glasses of water daily
Include whole grains, lean proteins, and healthy fats
Reduce salt intake to prevent hypertension
Avoid excessive caffeine and alcohol

physicalActivity.title: Physical Activity
tips: Aim for at least 30 minutes of exercise daily
Take regular breaks from sitting every hour
Include strength training 2–3 times per week
Practice stretching and flexibility exercises
Walk or cycle instead of driving when possible
Use stairs instead of elevators

mentalHealth.title: Mental Health
tips: Practice stress management techniques
Get adequate sleep (7–9 hours per night)
Maintain social connections and relationships
Practice mindfulness or meditation
Seek help when feeling overwhelmed
Engage in hobbies and activities you enjoy

hygiene.title: Hygiene
tips: Wash hands frequently with soap for 20 seconds
Cover mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing
Keep living and working spaces clean
Avoid touching your face frequently
Maintain proper personal hygiene habits

sleep.title: Sleep Hygiene
tips: Maintain a consistent sleep schedule
Create a relaxing bedtime routine
Keep your bedroom cool, dark, and quiet
Avoid screens at least 1 hour before bedtime
Limit caffeine intake in the evening

sun.title: Sun Protection
tips: Use sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher
Wear protective clothing in strong sun
Avoid peak sun hours (10 AM – 4 PM)
Wear sunglasses to protect your eyes
Reapply sunscreen every 2 hours outdoors

heart-attack.name: Heart Attack (Myocardial Infarction)
heart-attack.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart muscle is suddenly blocked, leading to tissue damage. It is a medical emergency.
symptoms: Pain in arms, neck, jaw, or back
heart-attack.causes: Blockage of coronary arteries due to plaque buildup or blood clots.
heart-attack.when_to_seek_help: Seek immediate emergency medical attention if chest pain or severe discomfort occurs.

assessment_questions.question: Are you experiencing chest pain or tightness?
Do you smoke cigarettes?

cardiac-arrest.name: Cardiac Arrest
cardiac-arrest.description: Cardiac arrest occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating, cutting off blood flow to the brain and other vital organs.
cardiac-arrest.causes: Electrical malfunction of the heart leading to abnormal heart rhythm.
prevention_tips: Use of implantable defibrillators if advised
cardiac-arrest.when_to_seek_help: Call emergency services immediately if a person collapses and is unresponsive.

assessment_questions.question: Have you ever been diagnosed with heart rhythm problems?

heart-failure.name: Heart Failure
heart-failure.description: A chronic condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet the body’s needs.
heart-failure.causes: Coronary artery disease, hypertension, damaged heart muscle.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience shortness of breath during routine activities?

hypertension.name: Hypertension
hypertension.description: A condition in which blood pressure remains consistently high over time.
hypertension.causes: Genetics, lifestyle factors, excess salt intake.

assessment_questions.question: Have you been told you have high blood pressure before?

coronary-artery-disease.name: Coronary Artery Disease
coronary-artery-disease.description: A condition caused by narrowing of coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel chest pain during physical activity?

lung-cancer.name: Lung Cancer
lung-cancer.description: A cancer that begins in the lungs, most commonly associated with smoking.
lung-cancer.causes: Long-term exposure to tobacco smoke or environmental pollutants.
lung-cancer.when_to_seek_help: Cough lasting more than 3 weeks or coughing blood.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have a persistent cough lasting more than 3 weeks?
Do you currently smoke or have you smoked before?

asthma.name: Asthma
asthma.description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and narrowing.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience wheezing or breathing difficulty?

bronchitis.name: Bronchitis
bronchitis.description: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes leading to coughing and mucus production.

assessment_questions.question: Are you producing mucus with your cough?

pneumonia.name: Pneumonia
pneumonia.description: An infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have fever with cough and chest pain?

sinusitis.name: Sinusitis
sinusitis.description: Inflammation of the sinuses causing facial pain and congestion.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have facial pain with nasal congestion?

copd.name: COPD
copd.description: A group of progressive lung diseases that block airflow.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience breathlessness during daily activities?

allergic-rhinitis.name: Allergic Rhinitis
allergic-rhinitis.description: An allergic reaction causing sneezing, congestion, and itchy eyes.
allergic-rhinitis.causes: Exposure to allergens like pollen or dust.

assessment_questions.question: Do your symptoms worsen during certain seasons?

acid-reflux-gerd.name: Acid Reflux (GERD)
acid-reflux-gerd.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus, causing irritation.
symptoms: Regurgitation of food or sour liquid
acid-reflux-gerd.causes: Weak lower esophageal sphincter allowing acid reflux.
prevention_tips: Do not lie down after eating
acid-reflux-gerd.when_to_seek_help: Frequent or severe heartburn not relieved by medication.

assessment_questions.question: Do you frequently experience burning sensation in your chest after meals?

gastritis.name: Gastritis
gastritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach lining that can cause pain and nausea.
gastritis.causes: Infection, excessive alcohol use, prolonged NSAID use.
gastritis.when_to_seek_help: Persistent stomach pain or vomiting blood.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience stomach pain or nausea after eating?

peptic-ulcer.name: Peptic Ulcer
peptic-ulcer.description: Open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or upper small intestine.
peptic-ulcer.causes: Helicobacter pylori infection or long-term NSAID use.
peptic-ulcer.when_to_seek_help: Severe abdominal pain or black stools.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience burning pain in your stomach that improves after eating?

ibs.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
ibs.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing cramping and bowel changes.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience abdominal pain along with changes in bowel habits?

jaundice.name: Jaundice
jaundice.description: A condition characterized by yellowing of the skin and eyes due to high bilirubin levels.
jaundice.causes: Liver disease, hepatitis, bile duct obstruction.
jaundice.when_to_seek_help: Sudden yellowing of skin or eyes.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed yellowing of your skin or eyes?

food-poisoning.name: Food Poisoning
food-poisoning.description: Illness caused by eating contaminated food.
food-poisoning.causes: Bacteria, viruses, or parasites in food.

assessment_questions.question: Did your symptoms start after eating outside or questionable food?

constipation.name: Constipation
constipation.description: A condition where bowel movements become infrequent or difficult.
constipation.when_to_seek_help: Persistent constipation lasting more than 2 weeks.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have fewer than three bowel movements per week?

stroke.name: Stroke
stroke.description: A medical emergency that occurs when blood supply to part of the brain is interrupted or reduced.
stroke.causes: Blocked or ruptured blood vessels in the brain.
stroke.when_to_seek_help: Immediate emergency medical attention is required.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced sudden weakness or numbness on one side of your body?

migraine.name: Migraine
migraine.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, recurring headaches.
migraine.when_to_seek_help: Severe or frequent headaches disrupting daily life.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience severe headaches with nausea or light sensitivity?

epilepsy.name: Epilepsy
epilepsy.description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced repeated seizure episodes?

parkinsons-disease.name: Parkinson’s Disease
parkinsons-disease.description: A progressive nervous system disorder affecting movement.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent tremors or muscle stiffness?

alzheimers-disease.name: Alzheimer’s Disease
alzheimers-disease.description: A progressive disorder that causes memory loss and cognitive decline.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed worsening memory problems over time?

vertigo.name: Vertigo
vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning or dizziness.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel a spinning sensation when changing head position?

dengue.name: Dengue
dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever and severe body pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had a sudden high fever with severe body pain?

malaria.name: Malaria
malaria.description: A life-threatening disease transmitted through mosquito bites.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience fever episodes with chills and sweating?

tuberculosis.name: Tuberculosis
tuberculosis.description: A bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have a cough lasting more than two weeks with weight loss?

typhoid-fever.name: Typhoid Fever
typhoid-fever.description: A bacterial infection spread through contaminated food and water.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had prolonged fever with abdominal discomfort?

cholera.name: Cholera
cholera.description: An acute diarrheal disease caused by contaminated water.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have sudden severe watery diarrhea?

hepatitis-b.name: Hepatitis B
hepatitis-b.description: A viral infection that attacks the liver.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed yellowing of your eyes or skin with fatigue?

hiv-aids.name: HIV/AIDS
hiv-aids.description: A chronic condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus that weakens the immune system.
hiv-aids.when_to_seek_help: Recurrent infections or unexplained weight loss.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced frequent infections or unexplained weight loss?

chickenpox.name: Chickenpox
chickenpox.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing itchy rash and fever.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have an itchy blister-like rash with fever?

back-pain.name: Back Pain
back-pain.description: Pain or discomfort in the upper, middle, or lower back.
back-pain.when_to_seek_help: Severe or persistent pain lasting more than a few weeks.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent back pain that limits movement?

sciatica.name: Sciatica
sciatica.description: Pain radiating along the sciatic nerve from the lower back to the leg.
sciatica.when_to_seek_help: Severe pain or weakness in leg.

assessment_questions.question: Does your pain radiate from the lower back to the leg?

arthritis.name: Arthritis
arthritis.description: Inflammation of one or more joints causing pain and stiffness.
arthritis.causes: Joint wear and tear or autoimmune conditions.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience joint stiffness especially in the morning?

osteoporosis.name: Osteoporosis
osteoporosis.description: A condition characterized by weakened bones and increased fracture risk.
osteoporosis.causes: Low bone density due to aging or hormonal changes.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced fractures from minor falls?

gout.name: Gout
gout.description: A form of arthritis characterized by sudden, severe joint pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you had sudden severe pain in a joint, especially the big toe?

fibromyalgia.name: Fibromyalgia
fibromyalgia.description: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain and fatigue.
fibromyalgia.causes: Abnormal pain processing in the brain.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience widespread body pain lasting more than 3 months?

type-2-diabetes.name: Type 2 Diabetes
type-2-diabetes.description: A chronic condition affecting how the body processes blood sugar.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience excessive thirst and frequent urination?

obesity.name: Obesity
obesity.description: A condition involving excessive body fat that increases health risks.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced significant weight gain recently?
Have you noticed unexplained weight changes or fatigue?

depression.name: Depression
depression.description: A mood disorder causing persistent feelings of sadness and loss of interest.
depression.when_to_seek_help: Thoughts of self-harm or inability to function daily.

assessment_questions.question: Have you been feeling persistently sad or hopeless for weeks?

anxiety-disorder.name: Anxiety Disorder
anxiety-disorder.description: A condition involving excessive fear, worry, or nervousness.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel anxious or worried most days?

insomnia.name: Insomnia
insomnia.description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
insomnia.when_to_seek_help: Persistent sleep problems affecting daily life.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have trouble falling or staying asleep most nights?

acne.name: Acne
acne.description: A skin condition that occurs when hair follicles become clogged with oil and dead skin cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have frequent pimples or clogged pores?

eczema.name: Eczema
eczema.description: A condition causing inflamed, itchy, and irritated skin.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience itchy, inflamed skin patches?

psoriasis.name: Psoriasis
psoriasis.description: An autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell buildup.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have thick, scaly patches on your skin?

skin-cancer-melanoma.name: Skin Cancer (Melanoma)
skin-cancer-melanoma.description: A serious form of skin cancer that develops from pigment-producing cells.
skin-cancer-melanoma.when_to_seek_help: Changes in size, shape, or color of a mole.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a mole changing in size, shape, or color?

glaucoma.name: Glaucoma
glaucoma.description: An eye condition that damages the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.
glaucoma.when_to_seek_help: Sudden vision changes or eye pain.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced gradual vision loss or eye pain?

cataracts.name: Cataracts
cataracts.description: Clouding of the eye lens leading to blurred vision.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have blurry vision or difficulty seeing at night?

conjunctivitis.name: Conjunctivitis
conjunctivitis.description: Inflammation of the conjunctiva, commonly known as pink eye.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have red, itchy eyes with discharge?

breast-cancer.name: Breast Cancer
breast-cancer.description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breast.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a new lump or change in your breast?

colorectal-cancer.name: Colorectal Cancer
colorectal-cancer.description: Cancer affecting the colon or rectum.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed blood in your stool or persistent bowel changes?

prostate-cancer.name: Prostate Cancer
prostate-cancer.description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have difficulty or pain during urination?

liver-cancer.name: Liver Cancer
liver-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the liver cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have persistent upper abdominal pain or yellowing of skin?

pancreatic-cancer.name: Pancreatic Cancer
pancreatic-cancer.description: Cancer that forms in the pancreas.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced unexplained weight loss with abdominal pain?

leukemia.name: Leukemia
leukemia.description: Cancer of the blood and bone marrow.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel unusually tired with frequent infections?
Have you noticed painless swelling of lymph nodes?

brain-cancer.name: Brain Cancer
brain-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the brain tissue.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have persistent headaches or new seizures?

ovarian-cancer.name: Ovarian Cancer
ovarian-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience persistent bloating or pelvic discomfort?

cervical-cancer.name: Cervical Cancer
cervical-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the cervix.

assessment_questions.question: Have you experienced abnormal vaginal bleeding?

thyroid-cancer.name: Thyroid Cancer
thyroid-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the thyroid gland.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed a new lump in your neck?

kidney-cancer.name: Kidney Cancer
kidney-cancer.description: Cancer that begins in the kidneys.

assessment_questions.question: Have you noticed blood in your urine?

bladder-cancer.name: Bladder Cancer
bladder-cancer.description: Cancer that develops in the bladder lining.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have blood in urine or pain while urinating?

oral-cancer.name: Oral Cancer
oral-cancer.description: Cancer that affects the mouth or throat.

assessment_questions.question: Do you have mouth sores that are not healing?

anemia.name: Anemia
anemia.description: A condition where the blood lacks enough healthy red blood cells.

assessment_questions.question: Do you feel tired or short of breath with minimal effort?

urinary-tract-infection.name: Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
urinary-tract-infection.description: An infection in any part of the urinary system.

assessment_questions.question: Do you experience burning sensation while urinating?

FindClinics.title: Find Nearby Clinics
FindClinics.subtitle: Search for healthcare facilities near your location using Google Maps

locationFound.title: Location Found
locationFound.description: Your location has been detected. Click any option below to find nearby facilities.

FindClinics.primaryCTA: Search All Healthcare Facilities Near Me

emergency.title: Emergency Services
emergency.description: In case of emergency, call these helplines immediately:

Emergency.title: Emergency Response Guide
Emergency.subtitle: Critical first-aid procedures and immediate response steps

cards.title: Diabetic Emergency
cards.subtitle: Hypoglycemia / Hyperglycemia
cards.description: Low or high blood sugar can cause serious complications. Quick recognition and action is important.

cards.title: Burn Emergency
cards.subtitle: Thermal Burns
cards.description: Serious burns require immediate cooling and medical attention to prevent complications.

cards.title: Seizure Emergency
cards.subtitle: Epileptic Seizure
cards.description: During a seizure, the person may shake, lose consciousness, or become confused.

cards.title: Heart Attack Emergency
cards.subtitle: Myocardial Infarction
cards.description: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. Every second counts.

cards.title: Stroke Emergency (FAST)
cards.subtitle: Cerebrovascular Accident
cards.description: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is interrupted. Time lost is brain lost.

cards.title: CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation)
cards.subtitle: Cardiac Arrest
cards.description: Immediate CPR can double or triple chances of survival.

cards.title: Choking Emergency
cards.subtitle: Airway Obstruction
cards.description: Quick action with Heimlich maneuver can save a life.

cards.title: Severe Allergic Reaction (Anaphylaxis)
cards.subtitle: Anaphylactic Shock
cards.description: Requires immediate epinephrine injection and emergency care.

diabetic-emergency.about: Low or high blood sugar can cause serious complications. Quick recognition and action is important.
steps: Check blood sugar if glucometer available
If LOW sugar: Give sugar immediately (juice, candy, glucose tablets)
Have person sit or lie down
If HIGH sugar: Offer water, call doctor
Call 108 if unconscious or having seizure
dos: Give sugar for low blood sugar
donts: Don’t give unconscious person food or drink
Don’t assume intoxication — check medical ID

burn-emergency.about: Serious burns require immediate cooling and medical attention to prevent complications and reduce damage.
recognize: Burns on face, hands, joints, or genitals
Deep burns with no pain (nerve damage)
steps: Cool burn with cool (not ice cold) running water for 10–20 minutes
Remove jewelry and tight clothing before swelling
Treat for shock — keep person warm and lying down
dos: Seek medical care for serious burns
donts: Don’t apply butter, oil, or ointments
Don’t give food or drink if severe

seizure-emergency.about: During a seizure, the person may shake, lose consciousness, or become confused.
steps: Move objects away to prevent injury
Call 108 if seizure lasts more than 5 minutes

heart-attack.about: A heart attack occurs when blood flow to the heart is blocked. Every second counts.
recognize: Pain in arm, jaw, or back

stroke.about: A stroke occurs when blood supply to the brain is interrupted. Time lost is brain lost.
steps: Do not give food or drink

cpr.about: Immediate CPR can double or triple chances of survival.
steps: Push hard and fast in center of chest

choking.about: Quick action with Heimlich maneuver can save a life.

anaphylaxis.about: Requires immediate epinephrine injection and emergency care.
steps: Lay person flat with legs raised

questions.question: Have you felt persistently sad or hopeless for more than two weeks?
Have you lost interest in activities you previously enjoyed?
Do you experience changes in sleep or appetite?
Do you feel fatigued or low on energy most days?
Have these symptoms affected your daily functioning?

high: Seek professional mental health care urgently

Do you experience physical symptoms like rapid heartbeat or sweating?
Do anxiety symptoms interfere with daily activities?

Do you have frequent or urgent urination?
Is your urine cloudy, foul-smelling, or bloody?

Have symptoms persisted for more than 2 days?
